title: Follower of US cult leader Charles Manson released from prison
description: Leslie Van Houten, 73, was serving a sentence for fatally stabbing a store owner and his wife in Los Angeles in 1969.

title: Jury declares pages from Aretha Franklin’s couch to be her will
description: Franklin's sons have disputed which version of their mother's will is valid following the singer's 2018 death.

title: NATO stops short of Ukraine invitation, angering Zelenskyy
description: Military alliance says it will invite Ukraine to become a member only when 'conditions are met' but gives no timeline.

title: Evidence in Canada lake indicates start of new Anthropocene epoch
description: A group of scientists say human activity has fundamentally altered the geology, atmosphere and biology of the earth.

title: Canada probes Nike, Dynasty Gold on forced Uighur labour in China
description: Nike Canada and Dynasty Gold are alleged to have or have had supply chains or operations in China using forced labour.

title: Bank of America fined $250m over junk fees, other issues
description: CFPB has launched a crackdown on a range of so-called 'junk fees' that it says lenders unfairly charge customers.

title: Sudan rejects African peace bid and ‘enemy’ peacekeeping force
description: Khartoum instead welcomes summit held by Egypt, widely seen as closer to the army than rival Rapid Support Forces.

title: Why did Turkey change its mind on Sweden’s NATO membership?
description: At its annual summit, the alliance is set to expand as it faces new security challenges.

title: NGOs lose contact with Tunisian migrant group, bodies found
description: Migrant rescue group says it has lost contact with a large group of Black African migrants expelled from Tunisia.

title: Muslim nations demand action after ‘Islamophobic’ Quran burning
description: Motion at UN Human Rights Council urges action over Quran burnings in Sweden that incite 'religious hatred'.

title: Cuba calls US nuclear submarine at Guantanamo Bay an ‘escalation’
description: Havana says it 'strongly' rejects the submarine's presence, describing it as a 'danger' to sovereignty in the Caribbean.

title: Thousands mourn Srebrenica victims as tensions mount in Bosnia
description: Dozens more victims of 1995 massacre buried after recently being identified through DNA analysis.

title: Global shipping regulator underwhelms with new emissions targets
description: New targets are to roll back emissions of freight ships that burn through millions of tonnes of dirty bunker fuel.

title: Israeli protesters rally at airport to stop judicial overhaul
description: Police arrest dozens in Tel Aviv as demonstrators mass at Ben Gurion Airport and in Jerusalem against gov't legislation.

title: US judge turns down challenge to Microsoft merger with Activision
description: Judge rejects challenge to $69bn acquisition in blow to efforts to crack down on economic consolidation in tech sector.

title: Tyson Fury to face Francis Ngannou in boxing megafight
description: Anticipated crossover bout to take place in Saudi Arabia's Riyadh on October 28.

title: Ukraine’s Svitolina shocks Swiatek to reach Wimbledon semifinals
description: Unseeded Ukrainian makes shock comeback over top seed to win 7-5, 6-7(5), 6-2 less than a year after giving birth.

title: India hits online gaming with 28% tax
description: Concerns have mounted over possible addiction to gaming apps and financial losses even as sector draws investors.

title: Russia vetoes UN vote to extend key Syria aid route
description: Russia proposes authorisation only be extended for six months rather than a nine-month compromise.

title: Offensive defence: How Putin saved NATO
description: In a period of great malaise in the West, the Russian president has given the alliance new meaning, mission and drive.

title: What are France’s SCALP missiles, and how can they help Ukraine?
description: France to deliver deep-strike missiles to Ukraine as part of increased efforts to help its counteroffensive.

title: Photos: Flash floods cause widespread damage in Northeast US
description: Heavy rains washed out roads and forced evacuations in Vermont and other parts of the Northeast; more rains expected.

title: Top Russian official says Poland wants to seize parts of Ukraine
description: Foreign ministry spokesperson Maria Zakharova touts theory often raised by Moscow without any evidence.

title: Trump team asks to delay documents trial, citing election run-up
description: Donald Trump is too busy campaigning for 2024 to prepare for US trial, lawyers say, asking for indefinite postponement.

title: Why Turkey changed its stance on Sweden’s NATO membership
description: Ankara supports Sweden's bid after it receives backing conditions from buying US F-16s to visa-free Schengen travel.

title: China’s ‘wolf warrior’ foreign minister ill, to miss ASEAN summit
description: Wang Yi, the former foreign minister, will take his place at the summit in Indonesia, a spokesman said.

title: Bat Couple: Nigeria’s bat researchers
description: For the love of bats, and each other, one couple leads the way in bat conservation and research in Nigeria.

title: As NATO meets on Ukraine, Russian officials fire warnings at West
description: Russia has long objected to Ukrainian membership of the alliance. This week's meeting is stirring old arguments.

title: Thailand PM Prayuth to retire from politics nine years after coup
description: The former army chief's party lost May's election to a party challenging the royalist military establishment.

title: Investments in private healthcare are not helping Africans
description: Development finance institutions should use their funds to help improve universal public services across the continent.

title: Olympic champion Caster Semenya wins testosterone ruling appeal
description: Europe's top human rights court rules double Olympic champion can appeal testosterone limit for female athletes.

title: Let’s talk about Jenin
description: If we are to have sustainable peace in Palestine, we should set the record straight on what’s happening in Jenin.

title: Pakistan gets $2bn from Saudi Arabia day before key IMF meeting
description: Kingdom deposits money into Pakistan's central bank before critical meeting of global lender on $3bn bailout package.

title: Australia ‘concerned’ by China-Solomon Islands policing deal
description: Australia urges the nations to publish details of the police deal which it says will 'invite further regional contest'.

title: Azerbaijan accuses Red Cross of smuggling, shuts road to Karabakh
description: Azerbaijan says the passage through Lachin checkpoint is closed due to a probe into smuggling by the Red Cross.

title: India top court to hear pleas on Article 370 removal in Kashmir
description: Supreme Court to begin hearing pleas challenging government's decision to revoke region's limited autonomy next month.

title: Israel expels Sub Labans from their home in Jerusalem’s Old City
description: The family fought settler attempts to take their home for about 45 years. On Monday night, security forces evicted them.

title: Search under way for toddler missing for third day in French Alps
description: Hundreds of volunteers are helping rescue services to look for a boy who went missing in the village of Haut-Vernet.

title: What does Sudan’s crisis mean for the gum arabic industry?
description: War between Sudanese army and paramilitary RSF threatens an industry that provides income for millions, analysts say.

title: ‘I knew it was a risk’: A Nigerian migrant sex worker in Ghana
description: How one woman made a desperate cross-border sacrifice to build a better life for her family and get them out of poverty.

title: Five killed in Nepal tourist chopper crash near Mount Everest
description: The chopper went missing in Solukhunvhu district, home to Mount Everest and other high mountain peaks, authorities say.

title: Soaring demand for honey keeps Jordan’s beekeepers busy
description: Jordan prides itself on producing 19 different types of honey, including citrus, eucalyptus and maple.

title: Daily life returns to Jenin camp after Israeli raid
description: A week from the Israeli offensive, residents are slowly going back to their lives, rebuilding what they can.

title: Market for clean energy minerals surges to $320bn: IEA
description: The market remains vulnerable to volatile prices, supply chain snarls and geopolitical tensions despite soaring demand.

title: Volcano erupts near Iceland’s capital
description: Iceland has 33 volcanic systems currently considered active, the highest number in Europe.

title: Egyptians launch online campaign for Gamal Mubarak as president
description: Campaigners launch Twitter hashtag and Facebook page, calling for Gamal Mubarak to run for president in April 2024.

title: Can Putin recover from the Wagner mutiny?
description: Russia's elites are distancing themselves from Putin, even if they won't revolt just yet, say analysts.

title: New Zealand starts trial into 2019 White Island volcano disaster
description: The owners of the island face charges over disaster that killed 22 people and seriously hurt dozens.

title: ‘Continent of opportunities’: Iran’s Raisi kicks off Africa tour
description: President is heading to Africa one month after a three-country trip to Latin America.

title: World Population Day: What will the world look like in 2050?
description: By 2050, after India and China, Nigeria is expected to become the world's third most populous nation.

title: Vietnam officials go on trial over alleged COVID flight bribes
description: More than 50 officials are accused of corruption over repatriation flights during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Libya jails 38 over deaths in Mediterranean Sea smuggling case
description: Five get life in jail over a trafficking case involving 11 people who died trying to cross the Mediterranean to Europe.

title: Australian democracy activist freed from prison in Vietnam
description: Chau Van Kham, who had been in jail for four years on national security charges, has returned home to Australia.

title: Russian submarine commander killed by gunman on morning run
description: Online news outlets claimed that Stanislav Rzhitsky was involved in a Russian missile attack on Ukraine that killed 23.

title: Facebook owner Meta tells inquiry it will label state actors
description: Executive tells Australian inquiry government-linked accounts will be identified on new Twitter-like platform Threads.

title: Indonesia’s electric battery hub bid clouded by mining deaths
description: Safety standards in Southeast Asian country's nickel mining industry are under scrutiny after spate of fatal accidents.

title: Australia to deploy surveillance aircraft to assist Ukraine
description: The Wedgetail with as many as 100 crew and support staff will operate from Germany for at least six months.

title: Russian attack on Ukrainian aid distribution point kills 7
description: Zaporizhia Governor Yuriy Malashko says Russian attack on school where humanitarian aid distributed a 'war crime'.

title: Dubious digital banking in India’s Bank of Baroda
description: Second-largest gov't-owned bank linked mobile numbers of strangers to boost app registrations, compromising security.

title: India’s Bank of Baroda tampered with accounts to flog app
description: Second-largest gov't-owned bank linked mobile numbers of strangers to boost app registrations, compromising security.

title: US charges Israeli-US think tank head with being Chinese agent
description: Gal Luft, who is a US and Israeli citizen, was arrested in Cyprus in February but fled after he was granted bail.

title: UN told Israel turns Palestinian territory into outdoor prison
description: UN expert says some 800,000 Palestinians, including children as young as 12, detained by Israel since 1967 occupation.

title: What does hosting Miss World mean for India today?
description: Notorious for sparking violent protests, an international beauty pageant returns to India.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 503
description: As the conflict enters its 503rd day, these are the main developments.
